is the county seat of Skagit County a city in the
.  In 1998 Mount Vernon was rated the #1 "Best Small City in America" by the New Rating Guide to Life in America's Small Cities.
Mount Vernon is situated along western Washington's main north-south transportation route, Interstate 5, where the major east-west highway SR 536 intersects.

value: Due to a recent bridge collapse along Interstate 5 north of Seattle between

, traffic through those communities may be delayed or detoured as repairs to the bridge are made. There is a 40 mph speed limit throughout the impacted area, including the temporary bridge span. Installation of the new bridge will require another full closure of I-5 in September after Labor Day. Expect lengthy travel delays.

The easiest and most common way to get to Mount Vernon is via Interstate 5 (or "I-5"), which passes through the city. I-5 gives convenient access from
to the south. SR 536 gives access (via SR 20) from
Railroad access is available through Amtrak. The railway extends north to

value: . Service to Mount Vernon from Bellingham on Route 80X
, where transfers from Sound Transit buses from Seattle are possible.

Public transportation in Mount Vernon is available via the Skagit Transit

bus service. Cost for bus service is extremely reasonable. However the buses do not run at night, so you have to be careful you do not get stranded.

Due to the size of the city, it is easy to travel by bike.

value: content=Every year during the month of April, to the delight of local businesses and irritation of local residents, the city celebrates the [ tulip festival]. Thousands of

residents and international visitors flock to see the endless fields of tulips just outside the city limits that paint the Skagit Valley more brilliantly than a Dutch impressionist could. During the peak of the tulip festival, First Street is closed downtown and local artists set up stalls. Partly as a result of this, at the height of the festival traffic downtown gets congested. It is therefore adviseable to use Best Road instead to reach the tulip fields.
name=Skagit Valley Highland Games & Celtic Festival

content=Usually celebrated during July (July 11-12, 2009). A shuttle runs from the "County" parking lot at the Kincaid Street exit off I-5.

content=A 24-hour drive thru espresso stand that offers a large variety of flavors of coffee, espresso, italian sodas, and other specialty drinks, in addition to pastries, bottled beverages, and cigarettes. Close to the freeway with amazing customer service! Try a Mythical White Mocha or a Nutty Yeti Latte! Legendary Creature... Legendary Coffee!
